(Simplified: 绶)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 受 indicates the sound; 糹 (silk) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 糹 [ sī ] silk; thread
    • 受 [ shòu ] to receive, to get, to accept; to bear
①一種絲質帶子，古代常用來拴在印紐上，後用來拴勳章：印綬。綬帶。
綬帶 [ shòu dài ]: ribbon (as a decoration); cordon (diagonal belt worn as a sign of office or honor)
(Simplified: 绶)

綬字的基本解释

綬
shòu
见“绶”。

綬字的汉语字典释义

[①]［shòu］
［《廣韻》殖酉切，上有，禪。］
“绶1”的繁体字。
(1)丝带。古代用以系佩玉、官印、帷幕等。绶带的颜色常用以标志不同的身份与等级。
(2)指衣带。

綬字的康熙字典解释

【未集中】【糸字部】　綬； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页927第12
【廣韻】殖酉切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】是酉切，?音受。【說文】綬韍，維也。【玉篇】綬，組也，綸紱也。【急就篇註】綬，受也，所以承受印環也。亦謂之璲。【後漢·輿服志】韍佩旣廢，秦乃以采組，連結於璲，光明章表，轉相結受，故謂之綬。【漢官儀】綬，長一尺二寸，法十二月，廣三尺，法天地人也。　又【周禮·天官】幕人掌帷幕幄帟綬之事。【註】綬，組綬，所以繫帷也。　又【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?承呪切，音授。義同。

Basic explanation of words
ribbon
shòu

ribbon
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［shòu］
["Guangyun" reproduces unitary cuts, there is on it, Zen. ]
Traditional characters for "绶1".
(1) Ribbon. In ancient times, it was used to tie jade, official seals, curtains, etc. The color of the ribbon is often used to mark different identities and grades.
(2) Refers to clothing belt.
ribbon
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Not concentrated] [Shizi Department] 　绶; Kangxi strokes: 14; Page number: page 927 to 12
[Guang Yun] Shuyu unitary cut [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Hui] [Zheng Yun] is unitary cut, sound acceptance. 【Said Wen】Shou Yun, Wei Ye. [Jade articles] Cogwheel, group also, Lun Fu also. [Anxiety to the article] Shou, accept, so accept the seal ring. It is also known as the 璲. [Later Han·Yufuzhi] Yun Peichang was abolished, and Qin was based on the mining group, connected to the 璲, the bright chapter, turning the phase and accepting, so it is called the cogwheel. [Han Guan Yi] The cogwheel, one foot and two inches long, is December of the law, three feet wide, and the world is also human.　[Zhou Li·Tianguan] The matter of the people holding the curtain. [Note] Cogwheel is a cogwheel, so it is also a curtain.　 [Guang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] [Zheng Yun]? Accepted and taught by sound. The same meaning.
